definition: to begin/to open/to start/beginning of an event

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
prologue of play/opening remarks/preamble (of speeches, articles etc)

sentences.english: The team failed to capitalize on their early lead.
sentences.chinese: 這個隊未能充分利用開場時領前的優勢。

sentences.english: On this high note the puppet show commences .
sentences.chinese: 木偶戲就在這陣高昂的調子裏開場了。

sentences.english: The movie begins with Superman’s failed search for Krypton.
sentences.chinese: 電影以超人尋找氪星人失敗開場。

sentences.english: By way of an introduction, I'd just like to give some historical background for this issue.
sentences.chinese: 作爲開場白，我來解釋一下這件事的歷史背景。

sentences.english: Let's just hope that we're just seeing a few getting-started hiccups.
sentences.chinese: 我們都希望看到的僅僅是幾個開場曲。

sentences.english: You don't engage in prolonged public displays of affection.
sentences.chinese: 你不會在公開場合長時間直露自己的情緒。

sentences.english: She begins by opening a colorful hatbox.
sentences.chinese: 她常用一個色彩斑斕的冒盒作爲自己的開場。

sentences.english: The score was five-nil with five minute left in the game.
sentences.chinese: 角逐離開場還有五分鐘時，兩邊比分爲五比零。

sentences.english: Added new movie to boot Imperial Company (Julii) and the introductory video.
sentences.chinese: 增加了新的尤利烏斯家族帝國會戰開場介紹性動畫。

sentences.english: In other words, this kind of question is often a lead-in to a suggestion or invitation.
sentences.chinese: 換言之，這種問題通常是建議或邀請的開場白。

sentences.english: The play opens on a cold night at Elsinore, the Danish royal castle.
sentences.chinese: 該劇開場於艾爾西諾皇家城堡一個寒冷的夜晚。

sentences.english: River had gone 1-0 up within the first five minutes.
sentences.chinese: 河牀在開場五分鐘就取得領先。

sentences.english: I'm talking about intros that ooze with concern.
sentences.chinese: 我講的是富有關懷的開場白。

sentences.english: But he ain’t had time to get good started yet.
sentences.chinese: 可是眼下，他恐怕還沒來得及準備好開場白呢。

sentences.english: Host and win 10 matches with at least 6 players present.
sentences.chinese: 開場且贏這10場配對，但至少需6位玩家同場。

definition: (of a performer) to come onto the stage to perform/(of an athlete) to enter the arena to compete/(fig.) to enter the scene (e.g. a new product)/(of an examinee etc) to leave the venue
to enter the venue/to enter the arena/(aviation) to approach the airfield/(investing) to get into the market
to go on stage/fig. to appear on the scene/used in advertising to mean new product
everyone present/the whole audience/across-the-board/unanimously/whole duration (of a competition or match)
the scene (of a crime, accident etc)/(on) the spot/(at) the site
